title: 14 Easy Fixes for a Tesla Phone Key Not Working

steps.title: Your phone key won't work if Bluetooth is off.
steps.content: Your phone key won't work if Bluetooth is off. You can touch the Bluetooth icon in Control Center for iPhones and Quick Settings for Android to enable it .

steps.title: Turn Bluetooth off and back on to fix temporary Bluetooth problems.
steps.content: Turn Bluetooth off and back on to fix temporary Bluetooth problems. If Bluetooth is on but your phone key isn't working, turn it off by tapping the icon in Control Center (iPhone) or Quick Settings (Android), then turn it back on.

steps.title: Many Tesla owners find that restarting the app fixes phone key problems.
steps.content: Many Tesla owners find that restarting the app fixes phone key problems. Be sure to completely close the app before reopening it: To completely close an app on iPhone , swipe up (or double tap the Home button if you have an older iPhone), then swipe up on the app to close it. To completely close an app on Android , swipe up (or tap the three-line icon at the bottom of your screen) to open the list of recently used apps, then swipe or tap the x to close an app.

steps.title: If this is off, your phone won't work as a key.
steps.content: If this is off, your phone won't work as a key. Open the Tesla app on your phone, tap Security & drivers and make sure "Phone Key" is on. This might reset whenever the app updates. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Sometimes a simple "turn it off, then back on" fixes everything.
steps.content: Sometimes a simple "turn it off, then back on" fixes everything. Generally, this should ultimately fix the phone key problem for many people. But if that's not the case for you, there are more troubleshooting steps that you can try! On iPhone X and newer, press and hold the right-side button and either Volume button simultaneously. Slide right on the power-off slider. Press the side button again to turn it back on. On iPhone SE, 8, or earlier, press and hold the side button, then slide left on the power-off slider. Press the side button again to turn it back on. [2] X Research source On an Android, press and hold the side button and slide the power slider to turn off your phone. Press the side button again to turn it back on. While you're in Control Center (iPhone) or the Quick Settings Panel (Android), you can also look to ensure Airplane Mode is off.

steps.title: Some phones use NFC to unlock your Tesla.
steps.content: Some phones use NFC to unlock your Tesla. NFC has a smaller range than Bluetooth and is more reliable, but you need to touch the phone to the car's driver-side pillar (like a key card). You can turn on NFC using Control Center (iPhone) or in Quick Settings (Android) .

steps.title: Your phone key won't work if you aren't signed into the Tesla app.
steps.content: Your phone key won't work if you aren't signed into the Tesla app. The page to sign in usually pops up as soon as you open the app if you're not signed in to an account.

steps.title: If the phone is low on battery, Bluetooth may not work.
steps.content: If the phone is low on battery, Bluetooth may not work. If Bluetooth isn't working, your phone key won't work, either. Plug your phone into power to charge it above at least 25% , as many phones will automatically enable low power mode when they reach critically low power levels.

steps.title: The Tesla app uses location permissions to communicate with your car.
steps.content: The Tesla app uses location permissions to communicate with your car. So if location isn't allowed, or if it's off, your phone key won't work. Follow these steps to manage location settings for your iPhone or Android: iPhone: Go to Settings > Privacy & Security > Location Services > Tesla App and toggle it on. [3] X Research source Android: Go to Settings > Location > App permissions (if the toggle isn't on here, enable it) > Tesla App > Allow all the time . [4] X Research source For Android and iPhone, the app should always be running in the background so you can use your Tesla.

steps.title: Outdated software can cause lots of issues, like your phone key not working.
steps.content: Outdated software can cause lots of issues, like your phone key not working. In Settings , you can find out if your iPhone or Android need an update. You can update the app by looking in the App Store or Google Play Store , even though those updates are usually automatic.

steps.title: Outdated software can cause your phone key to disconnect.
steps.content: Outdated software can cause your phone key to disconnect. You can get software updates over the air by going to Controls > Software on your car's touchscreen. [5] X Research source

steps.title: This might solve any BLE issues causing your phone key to disconnect or not work.
steps.content: This might solve any BLE issues causing your phone key to disconnect or not work. Make sure you're inside the car when you do this since this step will prevent you from using your phone as a key for the moment. Use a key fob or key card to get access to your car in the meantime. At your car's touchscreen, go to Controls > Lock and remove your "Phone as Key." Then set your "Phone as Key" again.

steps.title: Your current pairing may not be working properly.
steps.content: Your current pairing may not be working properly. You can unpair and re-pair your phone and car in Bluetooth settings. On iPhone, tap > Forget this Device [6] X Research source , on Android, tap Unpair . You want to make sure you're inside the car and using the touchscreen before unpairing your phone. Unpairing your phone will lock you out of your car. To pair your car and phone, sit in your car with Bluetooth enabled on your iPhone or Android and make sure the car's touchscreen is on. Tap the Bluetooth icon on the car's screen and tap Add New Device > Start Search . Tap your phone on the car's screen and confirm the random numbers on the screen with those on your phone. If prompted, tap Allow on your phone to let the car use your contacts and make calls. [7] X Research source

steps.title: The mobile app uses an internet connection to work with your Tesla.
steps.content: The mobile app uses an internet connection to work with your Tesla. Make sure you have Wi-Fi or mobile data enabled on your iPhone or Android and that the app can use them if it seems like the app isn't connecting to the car .

steps.title: Use the app to get more help.
steps.content: Use the app to get more help. Open the Tesla app on your phone, and tap Service > Ask a Question .
